metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1659 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.75 allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1659` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu1').
